alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 11:22PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL WICOMICO AND NORTHEASTERN WORCESTER COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1122 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Berlin, or 10 miles west of Ocean City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Berlin and Ocean Pines around 1125 PM EDT. Cape Isle Of Wight around 1130 PM EDT. Ocean City around 1135 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Bishop, West Ocean City, Ocean City Municipality, Bishopville, Ironshire, Showell, Whaleyville, and Willards. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern Maryland.
